thread.title: Canal Winchester mayor now unopposed after challenger leaves race
thread.title_full: Canal Winchester mayor now unopposed after challenger leaves race | The Columbus Dispatch

author: ThisWeek Community News
title: Canal Winchester mayor now unopposed after challenger leaves race
text:
Canal Winchester Mayor Mike Ebert will run uncontested on the Nov. 3 ballot after challenger Victor Paini unexpectedly withdrew from the race, citing work responsibilities.
Paini surprised supporters at what was supposed to be a campaign fundraiser last week with the announcement that he would no longer seek election.
>> Keep up on political news and insights with our Dispatch Politics newsletter. Sign up today. 
His name still will appear on the ballot in Franklin and Fairfield counties, but votes for him wonâ€™t count.
Paini currently serves as a Madison Township trustee, is a member of the Canal Winchester Landmarks Commission and is a representative to the Mid-Ohio Regional Planning Commission. He intends to remain in those roles.
editorial@thisweeknews.com
